page.title: 15LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: {MAYBOLE}is the traditional capital of the ancient S.Ayrshire district of Carrick.The name is from two Old English words{Mei_botl}meaning dwelling of the kinswoman.It represents a mid 7thC. Anglian settlement amongst the native Briton and Scots population. The town has connections with king Robert the Bruce whose family were Earls of Carrick.In the 16thC. it saw the faction feuds between the numerous branches of the Kennedy family. The S.Ayrshire gentry had their town houses and winter quarters in Maybole of which only the "Castle" built by the Earl of Cassilis at the foot of the high street remains and the foundations of the town house of the Blairquhan family within the tower of the town hall at its head.
